column5: Hey everyone,  Just wondering if anyone knows where I could get a DVD about the spawning habits of Canadian Trout or Salmon?  My "cousin-in-law" is over from the Netherlands, and is fascinated with the trout/salmon coming up stream to spawn, and I would like to get him a DVD to go home with before he leaves in a few weeks that is a documentary-type about them.  Anyone have an idea if these are available, if yes...where could I get one?   Thanks in advance.  *Stoty
ummm maybe check your local library???  Hawk
Your best bet is going to be ordering an older National Geographic/PBS or Nature episode...  I am sure they sell their episodes on DVD.

I dont know about DVD's but I know that over at gettinghooked.net they have downloadable episodes on trout and salmon fishing.  I particularly remember one called Dropback Steelhead.  I know, as well, that Bob Izumi's site Realfishing.com has streaming episodes of steelhead fishing in the Meaford area..
Song of the Salmon..National Film Board of Canada in Toronto. the last salmon...CBC?
